business.headline: The 'missing' Indian-origin CEO behind Rs 4,200 crore BlackRock loan fraudBankim Brahmbhatt, the Indian-origin CEO of a US-based telecom company, is facing a lawsuit in the US filed by HPS, the private credit investment arm of BlackRock.
Gold and silver shine again after slow start. Will they continue to rise?After a dull opening, both gold and silver managed to regain some shine during the day. Will the upward trend continue?

CBI links Anil Ambani, Rana Kapoor in Rs 2,796-crore Yes Bank loss caseThe CBI has accused industrialist Anil Ambani of approving favours to Yes Bank founder Rana Kapoor's family, causing huge financial losses to the bank. This development highlights alleged corruption and risky investments linked to Ambani's companies.

BlackRock-backed firm accuses Indian-origin entrepreneur of $500 million fraudA US-based telecom entrepreneur of Indian origin, Bankim Brahmbhatt, has been accused of orchestrating a USD 500 million loan fraud involving BlackRock-backed lender HPS Investment Partners.

Sensex, Nifty continue losing streak amid profit booking; BEL jumps 4%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 465.75 points lower at 83,938.71, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 155.75 points to 25,722.10. Selling pressure was broad-based, with most sectoral indices ending in the red.

Lenskart IPO crosses full subscription on Day 1; QIBs drive demandThe IPO opened today and closes on November 4. Lenskart has set a price band of Rs 382 to Rs 402 per share, with a lot size of 37 shares for retail bidders.

Gen Z leads India's crypto investments in Q3 2025: ReportThe 18–25 age group has officially overtaken the 26–35 bracket as the most active investors in crypto. For them, digital assets are no longer a risky experiment — they're becoming part of a serious investment plan.

From Groww to ICICI AMC: Key IPOs to watch this November 2025Bengaluru-based investing platform Groww is set to launch its IPO worth Rs 6,632.3 crore. The issue includes a fresh issue of Rs 1,060 crore and an offer for sale of Rs 5,572.3 crore.

Buying your first house? Check the 5x annual income rule and avoid EMI trapA rising number of first-time buyers are running the affordability math more cautiously. From the 5X income rule to avoiding EMI strain, housing decisions are shifting toward sustainability rather than stretch.

HNI India rebrands as Kokuyo Workplace India, targets leadership in Asia by 2030The rebranding marks a key step in Kokuyo's plan to make India a central hub for its Asia-Pacific operations. The move comes after Kokuyo's acquisition of HNI India earlier this year.

Employees unpaid, control slipping: Bira 91's bad hangoverThe taps are dry, employees unpaid, and investors have taken charge. The question isn't how Bira 91 got here anymore. It's whether it can get out.

Gold loan vs gold overdraft: Which one truly saves you money?Gold loans and gold overdrafts both help unlock the value of your jewellery when you need cash fast. But they don't work the same way — and one could quietly cost you more than you think.

From Aadhaar to bank rules: 7 key financial changes starting November 1As November begins, a fresh set of financial rules will come into effect that could impact your daily money matters. From Aadhaar updates and bank nomination changes to new GST slabs and card fees — here's a quick look at what's changing from November 1.

Air India seeks Rs 10,000 crore lifeline from Tata, SIA after crash: ReportThe request comes at a sensitive moment for the airline, which has been trying to rebuild its reputation, modernise its ageing fleet and streamline operations since being taken over by the Tata Group in 2022.

Meta plans record $30 billion bond sale to stay ahead in AI rcaseThe move comes as Meta signals that its capital expenditure in 2026 will be "notably larger" than next year, underscoring how aggressively it is investing to stay ahead in the AI race.

Lenskart IPO opens: Check GMP, price band, and should you apply?The total issue size is about Rs 7,278 crore, of which roughly Rs 2,150 crore is a fresh issue, while the rest is an offer for sale by existing shareholders.

Gold prices shaky, silver steady. What next for precious metals?Gold is wobbling as the dollar strengthens, while silver holds firm on industrial demand cues. With central banks still buying and the Fed unpredictable, where do precious metals go next?

Sensex, Nifty open flat in volatile trade; NTPC, Cipla among top losersAt around 9:24 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up just 21.15 points at 84,425.61, while the NSE Nifty50 edged higher by 7.35 points to 25,885.20. Broader market indices also hovered marginally higher, mirroring the lack of conviction at the headline level.

Gold and silver prices remain stable: Will prices gain after US Fed rate cut?Gold and silver prices steadied on Thursday after a choppy start, as investors weighed the impact of the US Federal Reserve's latest rate cut and awaited further clarity on global economic cues.

entertainment.headline: Mahesh Babu, Priyanka Chopra and SS Rajamouli tease fans with SSMB 29 hints Actors Mahesh Babu, Priyanka Chopra, and director SS Rajamouli stirred up curiosity among fans on Saturday with a lively social media conversation about their upcoming film 'SSMB 29'. The team confirmed that an update on the film will be released on November 2.

Shah Rukh Khan plans special fan meet in Bandra for 60th birthday Shah Rukh Khan will hold a special gathering for his fans on November 2 at Balgandharva Rangmandir in Mumbai's Bandra. The event will only be open to those holding passes distributed through his fan clubs.

Mahhi Vij reacts to divorce rumours, trashes talk of Rs 5 crore alimony demand Actor Mahhi Vij broke her silence on speculation around her marriage with Jay Bhanushali in a recent YouTube video. She also clarified the Rs 5 crore alimony rumours and appealed for privacy.

SRK birthday: Manish Malhotra wishes actor; Farah, Karan, others head to Alibaug The countdown to Shah Rukh Khan's birthday has begun. On Saturday, fashion designer Manish Malhotra shared birthday wishes for King Khan. Farah Khan, Karan Johar and Navya Naveli Nanda, amongst others, on the other hand, headed to Alibaug for celebrations.

The White House Effect review: When climate science became political fictionRelease Date:Fri Oct 31, 2025 The archival documentary, 'The White House Effect', exposes how political promises turned climate science into policy fiction. A sobering universal lesson: since world leaders lack accountability, the future of the global village now rests squarely on the compass of personal responsibility.

Lokesh Kanagaraj turns actor, romances Wamiqa Gabbi in DC. Watch teaser Tamil director Lokesh Kanagaraj is set to make his acting debut in the film 'DC', which pairs him opposite Wamiqa Gabbi. The film is directed by Arun Matheswaran and produced by Sun Pictures.

Anees Bazmee confirms Bhool Bhulaiyaa 4 with Kartik Aaryan is in works Filmmaker Anees Bazmee shared that 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 4' is in the works. He also confirmed in a recent interview that actor Kartik Aaryan would lead the next instalment.

One year of Singham Again: Arjun Kapoor celebrates love for Danger Lanka Actor Arjun Kapoor reflected on his experience playing Danger Lanka in 'Singham Again' as the film completed a year of release. He expressed his gratitude to director Rohit Shetty, the cast, and the audience with a special post.

Janhvi Kapoor turns Achiyyamma for Ram Charan's Peddi. Poster out The first look poster of Janhvi Kapoor from the much-anticipated film 'Peddi' has been released. The film, directed by Buchi Babu Sana and featuring Ram Charan, is set for release on March 27, 2026.

Baahubali: The Epic release sparks fan frenzy, scenes recreated in theatres As SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali: The Epic' hit theatres, audiences recreated some of the memorable scenes in theatres. The videos of their enthusiastic re-creations are now taking social media by storm.

The Reluctant Traveller S3 review: Eugene Levy charms with wit and wanderlustRelease Date:Fri Oct 31, 2025 Actor Eugene Levy embraces adventure in the third season of 'The Reluctant Traveller'. The series blends humour and heartfelt moments as Levy explores diverse cultures worldwide.

Anupam Kher teams up with Sooraj Barjatya for his 549th film, watch video Veteran actor Anupam Kher begins work on his 549th film, teaming up once again with acclaimed filmmaker Sooraj Barjatya. The announcement signifies a major milestone in Kher's extensive cinematic career and his longstanding association with Barjatya and Rajshri Films.

2PM's Taecyeon announces wedding plans with longtime girlfriend Taecyeon, a member of the South Korean group 2PM, will marry his longtime partner in a private ceremony in Seoul next spring, according to his agency 51K. The announcement comes after the couple was seen together in Paris earlier this year and has opted for a ceremony attended only by close friends and family.

Tremembe review: A quiet, unsettling look inside Brazil's most notorious prisonRelease Date:Fri Oct 31, 2025 'Tremembe' is a powerful Brazilian drama about life inside a high-security prison, showing what happens after the crimes are forgotten. With strong performances and realistic storytelling, it's a gripping watch about guilt, power, and survival.

Ajith Kumar reacts to Karur stampede, says society shares the blame Actor Ajith Kumar comments on the September Karur stampede, emphasising societal responsibility and addressing the culture of gatherings. He also discusses upcoming projects with director Adhik Ravichandran.

KBC 17: Can you answer the question that stumped Diljit Dosanjh? Singer Diljit Dosanjh impresses on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', securing Rs 50 lakh for Punjab flood victims and responding thoughtfully to questions from host Amitabh Bachchan.

Deepika Padukone's 8-hour stand: Can Bollywood agree on an ideal work culture? Deepika Padukone's call for an 8-hour workday has sparked a conversation. But can an industry obsessed with success arrive at a consensus over work ethics?

Do Bigha Zameen: Balraj Sahni's journey from privilege to the heart of India's struggle Bimal Roy's 'Do Bigha Zameen' (1953) redefined Indian cinema, transforming Balraj Sahni into the voice of India's struggling poor — a timeless story of dignity, loss and resilience.

Ranbir Kapoor to relaunch RK Studios with his directorial debut: Report Bollywood actor Ranbir Kapoor is preparing to relaunch the historic RK Studios, with plans for his directorial debut and collaborations involving top industry figures. The move marks a continuation of his family's cinematic legacy and aims to re-establish RK Studios as a creative force in Mumbai.

general news.headline: JDU Mokama candidate Anant Singh arrested in Jan Suraaj worker's murder caseJD(U) candidate Anant Singh was arrested by Patna Police in connection with the murder of Jan Suraaj worker Dularchand Yadav during election campaigning in Mokama.

Single narrow gate, crammed devotees: Andhra temple stampede was tragedy in makingAt least eight women and a boy lost their lives during the stampede at the temple in Srikakulam's Kasibugga town on Saturday.

In Lalu Yadav's home district, Amit Shah's 'jungle raj' attack on MahagathbandhanAmit Shah framed the contest as a choice between the development brought by PM Modi and CM Nitish Kumar, and the 'jungle raj' by the RJD-led Mahagathbandhan.

Multiple people stabbed on train near UK's Cambridge; 2 suspects arrestedMultiple people were stabbed on a train near Cambridge, prompting an armed police response and the arrest of two men at Huntingdon station. Several victims were hospitalized as UK PM Keir Starmer called the attack "appalling."

Why Indian parents delay divorce until kids are 'old enough'Parents often make an unspoken pact: hold on until the child finishes Class 10 or 12.  On paper, it sounds noble and selfless - but children still sense the emotional shutdown at home.

Work permit, H-1B, Civic Test: 3 changes in 2 months by US will hit Indians hardThe US has changed work permit rules overnight, doing away with automatic extension of certain Employment Authorisation Documents (EADs). Earlier, the Trump administration hiked annual H-1B visa fees and mandated stricter scrutiny for Green Card holders seeking US citizenship. These three moves in two months will hit Indians hard.

Trump threatens military action and aid cut to Nigeria over 'killing of Christians'US President Donald Trump threatened to halt aid and launch military action against Nigeria over alleged Christian persecution, accusing the government of inaction while Nigeria denies systematic religious killings.

FBI joins probe after 'intentional' explosion rocks Harvard Medical School buildingAn explosion rocked a Harvard Medical School building in Boston early Saturday, officials said. No injuries were reported, and investigators later determined the blast was intentional.

Fans furious as Women's World Cup final tickets get sold out before sale announcementFans were left outraged after tickets for the ICC Women's World Cup Final were marked "Sold Out" on BookMyShow before any official sale announcement, prompting criticism of BCCI and organisers over poor communication and lack of transparency.

Vreels: A Game-Changing Platform Pushing Social Media Beyond TikTok and InstagramVreels isn't just about sharing, it's about connecting meaningfully. Through built-in chat, voice, and video call features, users can communicate without leaving the app.

Skeletons tumble out: Mumbai hostage-taker's rental dispute, erratic behaviourRohit Arya, who held 17 children hostage at a Powai studio in Mumbai, has a controversial past. The 38-year-old was shot dead by police during the rescue operation.

Tejashwi Yadav confirms multiple Deputy CMs in Bihar, also from Muslim communityRJD leader and Opposition Chief Minister candidate Tejashwi Yadav confirmed in an India Today interview that the Mahagathbandhan will have multiple Deputy Chief Ministers, including one from the Muslim community, if it comes to power.

Shah Rukh Khan plans special fan meet in Bandra for 60th birthdayShah Rukh Khan will hold a special gathering for his fans on November 2 at Balgandharva Rangmandir in Mumbai's Bandra. The event will only be open to those holding passes distributed through his fan clubs.

See similarities of husband in JD: Erika Kirk's mushy hug with Vance sparks buzzWhat turned heads at the Turning Point USA event was the intimate hug between JD Vance and Erika Kirk, the widow of Trump aide Charlie Kirk, and her glowing words for the vice president.

Who cleared a Rs 34-crore cloud seeding plan after experts said 'not feasible'?Three expert agencies advised against it. Delhi did it anyway, spending Rs 34 crore of public money on a winter cloud seeding experiment that produced no rain.

Pak issues naval warning as India begins tri-services exercise near Sir CreekThe move follows Islamabad's recent Notice to Airmen (NOTAM), restricting several air routes across central and southern Pakistan from October 28-29.

3rd T20I Preview: Team selection under scrutiny ahead of Hobart gameIndia vs Australia: Suryakumar Yadav's side heads to Hobart with several questions surrounding their team selection. Is Shivam Dube really needed? What exactly is Sanju Samson's position in this line-up? India will have plenty to answer on Sunday.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Learn from past, Sangh can't be banned at anyone's whim: RSS hits back at KhargeEarlier this week, the Congress president asked Prime Minister Narendra Modi to ban the RSS in line with the decision of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, which came into existence in 1948, following the assassination of Mahatma Gandhi.

Video: Australian woman stuck in traffic praises Indian Uber driver for sweet gestureAn Australian woman shared a touching experience with her Indian Uber driver during Chhath Puja traffic, where she was stuck for two hours. She applauded his kind gesture, which won hearts on social media.

Why Bishnoi Gang is upping the ante in Canada?Even though Lawrence Bishnoi is in a jail in India, his gang has gone berserk in Canada. From shootings at Kapil Sharma's Kap's Cafe and a Punjabi singer's residence to killing an Indian-origin businessman, the Bishnoi Gang is asserting its deadly presence in Canada. But what's behind its latest spree of violence in Canada?

Why not engage with Hinduism too? Hindu body jabs Vance over wife's faith remarkThe Hindu American Foundation criticised Vice President JD Vance's remarks on his wife Usha Vance's faith, urging him to respect the rights of Hindus to practice. JD Vance had hoped that his wife would convert to Christianity one day, sparking a huge backlash.

What triggered stampede at Andhra's Venkateswara Swamy Temple? Glaring lapses exposedThe stampede occurred as a large crowd gathered at the temple on the occasion of Ekadashi, Andhra Chief Minister's Office said in a statement. Overcrowding because of the heavy rush led to the tragic incident.

Indian Railways to launch 4 new Vande Bharat trains on key routesIndian Railways is set to introduce four additional Vande Bharat Express trains, expanding the network and improving connectivity across several states.

sports.headline: India one step away from watershed moment as Women's World Cup set for new champion Women's World Cup 2025, IND vs SA: India will be aiming to end their long wait for an ICC title when they face a strong South African side on Sunday at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai. While India stunned seven-time champions Australia in the semifinals, the Proteas thrashed England by 125 runs to book their place in the final.

Babar Azam returns to form as Pakistan clinch T20I series vs South Africa Babar Azam roared back to form with a sublime 68 off 47 balls as Pakistan beat South Africa by four wickets in Lahore to clinch the T20I series 2–1. Shaheen Shah Afridi and debutant Usman Tariq starred with the ball, restricting South Africa to 139/9 before Pakistan sealed victory with six balls to spare.

Be fearless: Gambhir and co rally behind India's women's team before World Cup final The Indian men's team, including Gautam Gambhir, Suryakumar Yadav and Jasprit Bumrah, sent their best wishes to Harmanpreet Kaur's side ahead of the Women's World Cup final, urging them to stay fearless and enjoy the occasion in Navi Mumbai.

Amad Diallo's late volley earns Manchester United a 2-2 draw vs Nottingham Forest Amad Diallo's late volley salvaged a 2-2 draw for Manchester United at Nottingham Forest after Casemiro's opener was overturned by two quick goals. The equaliser saved United's unbeaten run but denied them the chance to climb higher in the Premier League table.

Najmul Hossain Shanto makes dramatic U-turn, returns as Bangladesh Test captain Najmul Hossain Shanto has made a surprise return as Bangladesh's Test captain, just months after stepping down, with the BCB reinstating him to lead through the 2025–27 World Test Championship cycle.

3rd T20I Preview: Team selection under scrutiny ahead of Hobart game India vs Australia: Suryakumar Yadav's side heads to Hobart with several questions surrounding their team selection. Is Shivam Dube really needed? What exactly is Sanju Samson's position in this line-up? India will have plenty to answer on Sunday.

India under a lot of pressure as they are expected to win: Laura Wolvaardt Women's World Cup, IND vs SA: In the pre-match press conference, South Africa skipper Laura Wolvaardt said that India are expected to win the final and hence, they will be under pressure to perform at the Dr DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Fans furious as Women's World Cup final tickets get sold out before sale announcement Fans were left outraged after tickets for the ICC Women's World Cup Final were marked "Sold Out" on BookMyShow before any official sale announcement, prompting criticism of BCCI and organisers over poor communication and lack of transparency.

Laura Wolvaardt gives Pat Cummins vibes, wants to silence India crowd in final Skipper Laura Wolvaardt said South Africa will look to silence the Indian fans when they face India in the Women's World Cup 2025 final in Navi Mumbai. Confident after their semi-final win over England, Wolvaardt said her team will start afresh in the grand finale.

Women's World Cup Final Predicted XI: Can India nail their winning combination? India and South Africa face off in a high-stakes Women's World Cup Final, with both teams expected to stick to their winning XIs. Harmanpreet Kaur remains tight-lipped on team selection as both captains eye a historic finish to a thrilling tournament.

India under a lot of pressure as they are expected to win: Laura Wolvaardt Women's World Cup, IND vs SA: In the pre-match press conference, South Africa skipper Laura Wolvaardt said that India are expected to win the final and hence, they will be under pressure to perform at the Dr DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Confident after their semi-final win over England, Wolvaardt said her team will start afresh in the grand finale.

Women's World Cup Final Predicted XI: Can India nail their winning combination? India and South Africa face off in a high-stakes Women's World Cup Final, with both teams expected to stick to their winning XIs. Harmanpreet Kaur remains tight-lipped on team selection as both captains eye a historic finish to a thrilling tournament.

Karun Nair makes his case for India recall with another Ranji hundredOut-of-favour India batter Karun Nair staked his claim for a national recall with a commanding unbeaten 142, steering Karnataka to 319 for three against Kerala on the opening day of their Group B Ranji Trophy encounter on Saturday.

No bigger motivation than playing Women's World Cup final at home: Harmanpreet KaurWomen's World Cup 2025, IND vs SA: Harmanpreet Kaur spoke about India's upcoming clash against South Africa on Sunday, saying it's a huge motivation for the team to play the grand finale on home soil.

Lionel Messi's India tour expands to Hyderabad after Kochi setbackAfter the cancellation of the Kochi event, Lionel Messi's GOAT Tour will now stop in Hyderabad, ensuring South India doesn't miss out on the football icon's visit. The tour will span Kolkata, Hyderabad, Mumbai, and New Delhi in December.

Know how it feels to lose, now want to experience winning World Cup: HarmanpreetIndia captain Harmanpreet Kaur said her team has endured the pain of losing on several occasions in the past but is now ready to experience the joy of winning a global title, ahead of their Women's World Cup final against South Africa at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Harmanpreet Kaur not undermining South Africa in final: They have a balanced sideHarmanpreet Kaur said India won't underestimate South Africa in the ICC Women's World Cup final, praising the Proteas for their strong comeback after their defeat to England in Guwahati in their first league match.

Rishabh Pant's brisk fifty keeps India A on track in 275-run chase vs SA ARishabh Pant's resilient and attacking fifty kept India A in contention as they reached 119 for four in pursuit of 275 against South Africa A. India A face a challenging final day with Pant unbeaten, having played a pivotal role after early setbacks.

Chase small wins: Harmanpreet Kaur's mantra to curb pressure in home World Cup finalUnder immense home pressure, India captain Harmanpreet Kaur urges her team to stay calm, focus on small goals, and enjoy the biggest moment of their careers as they take on South Africa in the Women's World Cup final at a packed DY Patil Stadium.

India vs Australia, 3rd T20I Predicted XI: Will Arshdeep finally get a chance?India vs Australia, 3rd T20I Predicted XI: India could make at least one change to their playing XI for the third T20I against Australia at the Bellerive Oval in Hobart on Sunday. With conditions expected to favour seamers, the team management might finally hand a game to Arshdeep Singh, whose exclusion so far has raised eyebrows.

India A face a challenging final day with Pant unbeaten, having played a pivotal role after early setbacks.

With conditions expected to favour seamers, the team management might finally hand a game to Arshdeep Singh, whose exclusion so far has raised eyebrows.

Women's World Cup: What happens if rain washes out India vs South Africa final?India and South Africa will battle for the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 title on November 2 at Navi Mumbai. However, rain could spoil the party for both teams in the all-important encounter.

Rohan Bopanna bids goodbye to professional tennis: Glorious career in numbersRohan Bopanna, one of India's most enduring tennis icons, has announced his retirement at 45, ending a remarkable two-decade career defined by passion and perseverance.

India vs South Africa: DY Patil pitch report, Navi Mumbai weather forecastIndia vs South Africa, Women's World Cup Final: In a clash to crown a new champion, India and South Africa will lock horns in a historic final at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai on Sunday. Here's everything you need to know about the title clash on November 2.

Sunidhi Chauhan to perform at mid-innings break in Women's World Cup finalIndian music powerhouse Sunidhi Chauhan will light up the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 final between India and South Africa in Navi Mumbai with a high-octane mid-innings performance.

BCCI tipped to match men's Rs 125 crore reward if India win Women's World Cup: ReportThe BCCI is reportedly planning a cash reward for the Indian women's cricket team if they win the 2025 Women's ODI World Cup, with discussions underway to match the Rs 125 crore prize given to the men's team after their 2024 T20 World Cup triumph.

Halloween special: Haaland walks streets of Manchester dressed as the jokerManchester City's Erling Haaland celebrated Halloween in style. He dressed up as The Joker from the Batman movies and went around the streets of Manchester.

Stars are aligned for India to win Women's World Cup final: Dinesh KarthikStars are aligned for India to win the Women's ODI World Cup, believes former cricketer Dinesh Karthik. The Women's World Cup is set to crown a new ODI champion.

England's ODI slide continues as New Zealand seal 3-0 series sweepNew Zealand skittled England's top order on their way to a nervy two-wicket win in the third one-day international in Wellington, completing a 3-0 series sweep and sending the tourists to Australia with serious questions over their batting form.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
